title: Travelers Posts Earnings Growth on Surging Premium Volume
sub_head: Property-casualty insurer’s net written premiums rises 10%, benefitting from fewer Covid-19 shutdowns and disruptions
body:
Travelers Cos. posted a 2% increase in fourth-quarter net income to hit a company record, with strong growth in premium volume contrasting with a year-earlier period hard-hit by the Covid-19 pandemic’s disruptions to the economy.
Travelers, one of the nation’s biggest sellers of insurance to businesses and a top consumer-car insurer, reported net income of $1.33 billion, up from $1.31 billion. Its closely watched core income, which excludes realized capital gains and other items judged nonrecurring items, also was up 2%, to $1.29 billion from $1.26 billion.
